options.text: "This is truly embarrassing!" states physician Dr. @@RANDOM_NAME@@, massaging @@HIS@@ temples. "We have become so reliant on these low-quality packaged meals that we have lost all perception of what good nutrition is! I suggest that we abolish fast food restaurants and these dreadful poor-quality ready-meals. Instead, we should encourage @@DEMONYM_PLURAL@@ to enjoy cooking their own wholesome food with fresh produce." @@HE@@ swats the bowl of [i]Ma Nature's Truly Triglyceride Macaroni and Cheese[/i] out of your hands. [[color=blue]Must have private industry[/color]]
options.result: courses in how to boil water are popular for formerly microwave-reliant @@DEMONYMNOUNPLURAL@@

options.text: "Our problem is that the nation has lost any sense of fine ingredients!" declares chef @@RANDOM_NAME@@, manager of @@CAPITAL@@'s finest eatery [i]The Gilded @@CURRENCY@@[/i]. "There's no need to ban the commercial food industry. You should merely ensure that manufacturers and chefs use better-quality ingredients. Once they have tasted food that's not filled with monosodium glutamate and E-numbers, they will be lining up at the door to taste all the fine cuisine @@NAME@@ has to offer. Such as the delights offered by my restaurant." @@HE@@ places a freshly-cooked deep-dish pizza in front of you.

options.text: Sniffing the air, a @@MAN_1@@ wanders into your dining room and picks up your spilled macaroni. "You gonna eat that?" @@HE@@ devours the soggy pasta with a satisfied sigh. "I really don't see the problem with processed meals. Firstly, they are the most delicious thing ever. Also, they're quick and easy to make, and cheap to buy. In fact, why do we need any other food? Whether you buy [i]Ma Nature[/i] or [i]Yums for Tums[/i], all microwavable meals are just so great! Why don't we ban all other food production, and make @@NAME@@ the world capital for microwavable cuisine? It would be ravioli heaven!" [[color=blue]Must have private industry[/color]]
options.result: there's a bustling black market for vegetables
